title: What are some melodious progressive rock songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1. King Crimson - “Lizard”; It is sort of a jazzy, medieval epic featuring Jon Anderson of Yes in his best contribution. 2. Robert Wyatt - “Sea Song”; this song sounds literally aquatic and sad, and features probably my favourite vocal performance in popular music. Not strictly proggy prog. 3. Wishbone Ash - “Sometime World”; fantastic melodic dual guitar attack...Iron Maiden stole a couple of guitar breaks from the album (Argus) featuring this. 4. Kevin Ayers - “Lady Rachel,” “Shouting in a Bucket Blues,” “Oh, Wot a Dream!”; Kevin Ayers is a favourite whimsical songwriter of mine who was with Soft Machine (that also featured Robert Wyatt) in their first album. “Shouting in a Bucket Blues” features outstanding melodic guitar playing from Steve Hillage and “Oh, Wot a Dream!” is allegedly about Syd Barrett. 5. Jethro Tull - “Thick as a Brick”; a famous no-brainer epic. 6. Premiata Forneria Marconi (PFM) - “Appena Un Po”; lovely Italian progressive rock 7. Matching Mole - “O Caroline”; a lovely ballad from a definitive Canterbury style band featuring Robert Wyatt and Dave Sinclair (also of Caravan; see below) 8. Caravan - “Nine Feet Underground”; another definitive Canterbury style band, but this is an epic...and very English too. 9. Gentle Giant - “The Advent of Panurge”; this is a lovely, unique band playing in a medieval style and thematically matching Rabelais’ Gargantua and Pantagruel to quite some extent. Note: I am not a fan of Yes, Genesis, ELP, Kansas, Rush and the like, and not a fan of symphonic prog at all. However, as a collector, I have enjoyed wacky and whimsical obscurities of the progressive rock/krautrock/space rock genre a lot.

From what I've listened to so far ( I haven't listened to enough yet). I'm gonna name 3 from each band. Emerson,Lake & Palmer - From the beginningJerusalemLucky ManR.I.P Keith Emerson and Greg Lake. Pink Floyd Shine on you crazy diamondAtom heart mother ( Very Underrated)Echoes ( Live at Pompei version)R.I.P Syd Barrett & Richard Wright Opeth BurdenPatterns in the ivyFace of melindaPorcupine Tree Nine CatsLazarusTrainsYes Heart of the sunriseClose to the edgeRoundaboutThe moody blues Tuesday afternoonNights in white SatanI know I've listened to very less. These are the ones the came to my mind. Happy listening.
